chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
DEFENDANT TO ALSO SIGN A CASH BOND OF $100.00
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is to enroll and comply with the conditions at Bethany House.  Defendant to complete the in-patient treatment at Bethany House.
No WCS monitoring while she is at Bethany House.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 
Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. 
Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. 
Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
